about_text_1: Hi, I’m Vergil, a senior frontend engineer with experience in system architecture design and team leadership. I am currently advancing my skills in backend development, databases, and AI-assisted development optimization.
about_text_2: Skilled in building projects from scratch, refactoring legacy systems, and flexibly designing modular architectures and frontend-backend collaboration strategies based on product goals. Previously led frontend teams of 3-10 people, helped multiple Junior engineers grow, and introduced workflow optimizations such as GitLab Flow, Automatic i18n translation, and AI agents collaboration tools to improve team development efficiency and quality stability.
about_text_3: I have led multiple medium-scale projects, from backend systems to innovative applications integrated with hardware, including a navigation map project for visually impaired people in collaboration with Chunghwa Telecom company and Chinway Technology company, serving as product lead and main developer, participating throughout from packet protocol design to APP development and architecture setup. These experiences allow me to integrate technical and business requirements from a global perspective, ensuring project implementation and sustainable development.
about_text_4: In terms of experience, I am proficient with modern frontend frameworks and mainstream development tools. Place strong emphasis on development experience, able to select the most suitable frameworks and tools based on project type while considering cost and device constraints to define an appropriate strategy. I have extensive experience integrating APIs from various services and leveraging automation tools to enhance team delivery quality and streamline automated workflows.
about_text_5: Passionate about knowledge sharing and skilled in cross-departmental communication, I value the contribution of every role. I believe that when team members understand each other’s work styles and needs, complementary collaboration naturally follows, enabling smooth teamwork and continuous growth of overall practical capabilities.
about_text_6: Good process design and clear goal orientation are the best foundation for teams to achieve each milestone.
about_text_7: I prioritize business-oriented thinking and not limited by the design constraints of third-party tools. I approach projects from the perspective of requirements, evaluating the feasibility and value of underlying system architectures.

job_detail_1_1: As a senior engineer in a 5-person frontend team, including 3 junior members, responsible for daily technical guidance and PR review, helping the team maintain code quality and technical growth.

job_detail_1_3: Led backend system development and maintenance (Legacy project developed by former employees), refactored multi-level permission verification mechanism, implemented operation permissions and page visibility control mechanism based on CRUD permissions.

job_detail_1_5: In the absence of design resources, used Canva to create and modify design drafts, redesigned multiple backend pages to improve user experience and visual consistency.
job_detail_1_6:
Developed an AI-powered translation script to automatically synchronize the en locale file to other languages.
Integrated the script into the Husky pre-commit workflow, leveraging the OpenAI and Google Translate APIs for real-time translation.
This approach significantly improved multilingual maintenance efficiency and consistency by offloading translation tasks to automated scripts, saving the team an average of 30% of their time and allowing them to focus on higher-value business work.
job_detail_1_7: To improve the confusion of backend error messages (the project has grown to a scale where there are no resources to reorganize each API's error handling), proposed an automatic error message translation mechanism based on locale code settings: storing language codes in cookies, backend using this to check database mapping, if no data then using remote service translation and storing in database, and returning corresponding language error messages, frontend then displaying localized content based on error codes, Significantly improved the usability and user-friendliness of the platform’s notification and modal messaging design.

My primary responsibilities include handling large-scale form processing on the platform, managing extensive parameter configurations for dynamic field setups, and developing data visualization and analytical charting features.

job_detail_5_sub_1: Served as the product owner for the in-house Bluetooth protocol–based broadcast product SBeacon, leading a three-member team (backend engineer, mobile engineer, and UI designer) and overseeing the full lifecycle from technical R&D through product validation and market rollout.
job_detail_5_sub_2: Responsible for engineering the iOS and Android applications, successfully launching both platforms with full support for interaction with Bluetooth devices.
job_detail_5_sub_3: Collaborated with hardware team, integrated Bluetooth 4.0 module, designed proprietary protocol packets, and introduced AES-256 dynamic encryption technology, ensuring transmission security and device controllability.
job_detail_5_sub_4:
As a pre-sales contributor, I successfully supported proposal presentations to Chunghwa Telecom and the relevant government authorities. Following two years of product development and on-site validation, the solution was formally verified and delivered.

Independent third-party testing confirmed that the SBeacon signal achieved an on-site accuracy rate of up to 92%, significantly exceeding the highest reported result of 64% from overseas university research. This milestone marked the successful completion of the project delivery.

The project ultimately secured a NTD 18 million government procurement contract, enabling deployment across major highway service areas and designated library locations, and granting the product formal market entry and large-scale rollout opportunities.
job_detail_5_sub_5:
Managed the demonstration of the SBeacon product at the Shilin–Yuanshan exhibition, with testing participation from the Visually Impaired Association.

Rapidly addressed a critical pre-exhibition bug in the application layer that caused the demo to fail. Coordinated with Apple to initiate an emergency app review, compressing the standard three- to four-week review process into a single night, ensuring the application was successfully redeployed in time for the exhibition.
